meanings.definition: Absence or lack of a quality or attribute
meanings.sent1: The privative of light is darkness.
meanings.sent2: The privative of happiness is sadness.
meanings.sent3: His room was a privative of color, with only black and white.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the forest was a privative of sound.
meanings.sent5: The hunger in his stomach was a privative of food.

meanings.definition: Having the nature of taking away or depriving
meanings.sent1: The privative force of the storm took away the roof.
meanings.sent2: The privative nature of the medicine reduced the pain.
meanings.sent3: Her magic wand had a privative effect on the evil spirits.
meanings.sent4: The privative power of the vacuum cleaner sucked up all the dirt.
meanings.sent5: The privative spell cast by the wizard made everything disappear.

meanings.definition: Marked by the absence or loss of something
meanings.sent1: The privative room felt empty without any furniture.
meanings.sent2: The privative sky was devoid of stars that night.
meanings.sent3: His privative collection of toys made him feel lonely.
meanings.sent4: The privative landscape was barren and desolate.
meanings.sent5: The privative garden had no flowers, only weeds.
